H0.text: Sea water is most likely to be brackish.

H1.text: Lake is the type of water body most likely to be brackish.

H2.text: River is the location where water is most likely to be brackish.

H3.text: Estuary is where water is most likely to be brackish, as the mixing of freshwater and saltwater creates brackish conditions.

A4.text: An estuary is a partially enclosed coastal body of brackish water where freshwater from rivers or streams meets and mixes with saltwater from the open sea.

A5.text: Estuaries form transition zones between riverine and marine environments and are classified as ecotones, areas where different ecosystems overlap.
